intro: Gurania martiana, commonly known as the mountain balsam, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant features hairy, alternate leaves and produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its seeds are enclosed in a capsule and are dispersed by wind, aiding in its survival in rugged mountain environments. Gurania martiana is adapted to cold climates and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky areas.
